Method Detail

sendInvocation

public void sendInvocation(int invocationHashCode,
                           java.lang.String methodName,
                           Datatype[] args,
                           java.lang.String sessionName,
                           byte[] sessionSig)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: Link
Invokes a specified method of a service associated with a specified user. Since it throws the RemoteException, it can be remotely invoked with Java's RMI protocol.

This method applies the security policy to check the session identity.

Specified by:
sendInvocation in interface Link
Parameters:
invocationHashCode - the hash code of the method invocation. If negative, then the method returns no value
methodName - name of the method being invoked modelName.portName.methodName
args - arguments to be passed to the specified method
sessionName - the session identity for security checking
sessionSig - the signature of the user
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

sendDatatype

public void sendDatatype(int invocationHashCode,
                         Datatype data,
                         java.lang.String sessionName,
                         byte[] sessionSig)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: Link
Sends a Datatype parameter as a result of an invocation received by the sendInvocation method. Since it throws the RemoteException, it can be remotely invoked with Java's RMI protocol.

This method should be used to implement non-blocking port method invocations.

Specified by:
sendDatatype in interface Link
Parameters:
invocationHashCode - the hash code of the method invocation received with sendInvocation
data - the Datatype object corresponding to the result of the specified method
sessionName - TODO
sessionSig - TODO
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
